timeline.bodyText: Using a method to obtain the name of the config is okay for now, but I would like to see a cleaner (more automagic) approach to this. Maybe some sort of mechanism in AutoConfigManager that automatically retrieves the (translatable) name from some common place, or an annotation on the config class? At the very least, I'd recommend making this method non-abstract and returning the simple name of the config class as the default. We should discuss this in a follow-up AutoConfig issue after the PR is merged, ideally after we have a better idea of its scope and usage.
timeline.author: eviltak

replies.bodyText: To clarify: I don't think we need to make the change in this PR, but this is definitely something to look at in the near future.
replies.author: eviltak

replies.bodyText: But there show that you should do it explicitly + this property support translation.
replies.author: DarkWeird

replies.bodyText: It should be driven by how translations are managed currently from the engine. just retrieving the base name seems fine in the cases. seems simple enough without adding additional complexity.
replies.author: pollend

timeline.bodyText:

timeline.bodyText: What's the rationale behind the creation of a new context here?

replies.bodyText: I catch problem there... seems with modules and autoconfigs, or TypeWidgetHandlers...  don't remember exacly
replies.author: DarkWeird

replies.bodyText: Thanks! As long as it works, I don't have a problem. Wanted to know for my own knowledge.
replies.author: eviltak

timeline.bodyText: Do we want to put this here, visible in the settings menu where players may also access it? I'd rather just instantiate and view these test screens via the console command (and not have them be accessible via the UI).
timeline.author: eviltak

replies.bodyText:
Idk how do it with command :)
just debug screens for presentation. should will remove before merge. (Outstanding)
replies.author: DarkWeird

replies.bodyText: Sounds good. There is a console command to create and display any UI screen (I forgot which one).
replies.author: eviltak

timeline.bodyText: Let's not do this here; let's instead use the annotation and inject the ModuleManager and AssetManager dependencies via @In or create and add the AutoConfigWidgetFactory to the registry in the initialization phase of AutoConfigManager. This will make life easier when we move the type widget library into TeraNUI and extract AutoConfig into its own separate repository. For proper modularity, I would prefer the annotation and injection approach, so that we can separate AutoConfig from the AutoConfig UI implementation as well (if we need to for DestSol, for example).
timeline.author: eviltak

replies.bodyText:
I too :D
But our current DI too weak.
Not supports: Collection Inject (best way for Libraries and generators), jsr310.
BestPractics for DI-world  - use constructor or setters don't break incapsulation.
aaand we have gestalt-di PR which provides nice DI implementation inspired by Spring and Micronauts.
By my opinion it should instroduce in DS firsts.
(also i have some PRs for DI, which prefers Constructor inject and using jsr310(@Inject)and spread DI from heard of engine)
replies.author: DarkWeird

replies.bodyText: In that case, let's move this to AutoConfigManager or even ConfigurationSubsystem.initialise() at least. It definitely shouldn't be here, since (as the method name suggests) we only want to add widget factories of builtin types here.
replies.author: eviltak

timeline.bodyText: As above; I don't think we should make these test screens visible in the main game UI. If we need to view them, we can always use the console command to load them.

should will remove before merge

timeline.bodyText: Are we still keeping this here? If yes, we must make sure to remove this before the next release. I would still prefer getting rid of this button entirely and using the showScreen engine:autoConfigTestScreen command to load this screen whenever needed for testing. That's the approach I used to load the type widget factory test screens as well.
timeline.author: eviltak

replies.bodyText:
Oh. I forgot to refactor names.
It should be AutoSettingsScreen. Not Test.
It should be as place, which can be improved soon. Or contract place between autoconfigs and typewidgetlibrary
replies.author: DarkWeird

replies.bodyText: Ah, so is it the screen that currently houses all AutoConfigs (like AudioConfig and in the future SystemConfig)? If it is a non-testing screen and is actually meant to be exposed to players, then we can keep this here. We should in the near future figure out a good way to expose autoconfig screens to the end user though.
